split_speech_text: this year marks the centennial anniversary of the proclamation of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: QUOTE_START "The leadership, vision and commitment of the Government of Saudi Arabia and its people have created a society where education, economic development and diversification have become priorities.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: QUOTE_CONTINUE The development of infrastructure and the petrochemical industry have transformed a barren land into one of the most advanced nations of the world.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: QUOTE_END The Saudi Arabian people have built a moderate nation that is dedicated to promoting peace and stability".
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: On behalf of my colleagues and all Canadians, I ask His Excellency Dr. Mohammed Al-Hussaini, the Ambassador of Saudi Arabia, to extend our warmest congratulations to the Government of Saudi Arabia and its people, the people of this exceptional nation.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: I would like to wish them a happy anniversary.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: on November 10, UN Women elected its first executive board.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: This new agency “will work...to improve the status of women and girls”, said United Nations Deputy Secretary-General Asha-Rose Migiro.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: This entity, charged with ensuring that the UN's commitments to establish gender equality within its institutions are kept, is a competent authority among member states for bringing about this equality.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: It is troubling to see that Saudi Arabia has a seat on this executive board.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The customs and traditions of that country infringe on women's rights daily.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: It is a country where Nathalie Morin, a Quebecker, is stuck and being held prisoner, along with her children.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: If Saudi Arabia wants to demonstrate its desire for equality and justice between men and women, then its authorities have to take the first concrete step and let Nathalie Morin and her children return to Quebec.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: if equality is the ultimate goal that a civil society aspires to, then racism is its implacable foe.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: Canadians have struggled and fought hard against the vile enemy of social cohesion and although we have been enormously successful in integrating almost 200 different nationalities, we are far from perfect.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The ghettoization in large centres, the enormous difficulties aboriginal people face in integrating into Canadian society, the politically correct reverse discrimination that occurs still demonstrate that much needs to be done.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: We must continue to enforce laws that penalize the purveyors of racism, ensure that racism labels are never falsely used, strengthen the level playing field where opportunities exist and the responsibility to take advantage of those opportunities rests with the individual, and that people are judged on their merit and not on the colour of their skin.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: On this international day of elimination of racial discrimination I would like to thank Canada for the opportunity that Canada has given to me to be judged not on the colour of my skin but on my abilities.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: prostitution is not a career choice.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Many women get involved in prostitution to feed their drug addiction.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: Fines and prison are not the solution to drug-related prostitution.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Prevention is better than repression.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: We have to address the problem at its source.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: In other words, we have to address substance abuse and addiction.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: That is what a number of groups and elected officials are trying to do in Hochelaga.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The community organization Dopamine, which works in addictions services, wants to relocate to a neighbourhood where the need for its services is greatest.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: A respite care centre would be set up at Dopamine's former location where prostitutes could go to shower and sleep, and get help when they are ready to get out of the business.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: However, despite the recommendation of the Agence de santé de Montréal, the application to the Homelessness Partnering Strategy to relocate Dopamine has been dragging on for months.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: What is more, I have received no response to the letter I sent to the Minister of Human Resources explaining this increasingly critical situation.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: I hope to receive a positive response soon and I hope that the budget tabled a little later on will not abandon these people who feel increasingly forgotten by society.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: as Canadians we have a lot to be proud of, but we must take responsibility for the not so great.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: It is shameful that with all we know that the continued abuse and victimization of women and children exists in our society.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The sex trade creates many victims.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Some people from my town see this every day.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: People are fed up with seeing drug and prostitution paraphernalia littered through their neighbourhoods and have taken matters into their own hands by creating a group called Residents Against Street Solicitation.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: It is known as RASS, Residents against Street Prostitution and Solicitation.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: I call on the government to stand up for women and children, and provide more resources and social programs to women in need.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Prostitution is a problem that illustrates the social inequalities between the sexes.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The government wants to protect men with guns, but is doing very little to assist women and their families.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: If it is not right for our daughters, mothers or our wives, it is not right for any woman.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: I find the continued existence of and the increase in poverty in Canada extremely worrisome.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: According to the Hunger Count 2011 Report, released on November 16 by Banques alimentaires Québec, the use of food banks has increased by 22% in Quebec since 2008.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: What is more, 15.6% of people used a food bank for the first time.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Nearly three times as many seniors are using food banks and nearly half of the households asking for help are families with children.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: This situation is very troubling.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: In my riding, unemployment is high and the population is aging.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: These factors obviously affect the need for food aid.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The Louiseville organization called Le Noël du pauvre has noticed an increase in requests for help.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: I feel it is our duty, as elected members, to work to implement measures that will fight poverty in Canada.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: I am committed to doing just that, as are my NDP colleagues, and I urge the government to do the same.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Canada's economy may be doing well, but across the country there are millions of Canadians who live in poverty.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: This is especially true for women and children, as has been reported across the country today.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Single female seniors are particularly challenged.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: One report provides the example of a single female senior who, having worked all her life to raise her three children, has had to give up her car, buy second-hand clothes and live on combined benefits of $16,000 per year.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The United Nations agency for children, UNICEF, reports that in Canada “our children are suffering from unacceptable rates of poverty”.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The levels of poverty in this country, especially for women and children, are totally unacceptable.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The Leader of the Opposition has recently outlined real and meaningful plans to deal with the issue of poverty in Canada, but from the government we hear nothing.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: That is an absolute shame.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Canadians deserve better.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: the group Canadians Addressing Sexual Exploitation has sponsored white ribbon against pornography week and some of the members of the House are wearing white ribbons in support of this.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: People who view pornography are affected in different ways, but they are all affected.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Child molesters have been shaped by the pornography they view.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Individuals who become rapists have by pornography been desensitized to the personhood and dignity of women.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: And those seduced by pornography who do not become sexual criminals nevertheless develop a contaminated view of human sexuality.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: This breeds unfaithfulness to one's spouse and is therefore destructive to families.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: We are reminded of the need to restrain the pornography industry which causes so much personal devastation and societal harm.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Those opposing this cancer are to be commended for their courage and endeavours in these days.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: how can Canadians trust the Liberals when they say they will protect children and then avoid positive action on the possession of child pornography?
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The recent throne speech said that the government would work with Canadians to ensure that our communities continue to be safe.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: Its focus will be balanced, combining prevention and a community centred approach with action to deal with serious crime.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Child pornography is a serious crime and in response on Friday 300,000 Canadians voiced their community-centred approach through a petition against child pornography insisting the government defend the law.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: In response, the justice minister accuses Reform members of being scaremongers.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: Obviously the minister does not feel obligated to the community will, and also has no ability to get cabinet approval for action.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Children are the most vulnerable members of society and they deserve the fullest protection of the law.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: Liberal sentiments delivered in regal fashion do not close legal loopholes or defend families.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The poor Liberal justice system will only be improved when the system defenders are replaced by the system changers in the opposition.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: young people who do not want to use drugs have come to me expressing grave concerns about what is happening in their communities, all because the Liberal government is sending the wrong message across Canada about drugs.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: By decriminalizing marijuana, our government is forcing our youth to live in a world where drug use is making life more difficult.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Psychological pressure to use marijuana is increasing.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Drug induced crime creates more tension and problems.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: A good education is more difficult to obtain because of the negative behaviour and attitudes of their classmates using pot.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Drug offences in Saskatchewan have increased by 97% in the last 10 years.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Our youth deserve better.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Being free to grow and develop should be their right.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: Instead, the damaging influence of drug use pollutes their environment.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: Protecting Canada's youth should be our number one priority.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Why does the Liberal government care so little about our young people?
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: there may be a, shall we say, pink elephant in the room when it comes to the legalization of marijuana.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: First let us talk about the risks.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Quebeckers are aware of them.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Some of those risks include normalization of marijuana use, public health impacts, and increased use by our young people, just to name a few.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Then there is production.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The opening of this new market should benefit more than just the Liberals' friends.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: As we have seen, almost every cannabis company has a former minister or well-known Liberal on its board of directors.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: If we vote to legalize marijuana, it must be done right.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: It must not have a negative impact on our young people or the general public, and it must certainly not be done just to benefit the Liberals' friends.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: The government has not yet done anything to address Quebeckers' concerns or to avoid the appearance of a conflict of interest.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: Things are off to a bad start.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: I stand in the House today to once again voice my complete commitment to stricter gun control legislation.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: On November 8, Dr. Gary Romalis, my constituent, was shot while eating breakfast in his kitchen.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: For Canadians incidents of this nature are horrifying and incomprehensible.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: They should not have to be endured by any society.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: I implore all my colleagues to work toward more effective gun control and crime prevention measures.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: We must make shootings of this nature a thing of the past.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: I feel deeply for Dr. Romalis and his family.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: I know I am joined by all members of this House in wishing him a full and speedy recovery.
label: conclusion

split_speech_text: I am very disturbed by the number of shootings on Canadian streets and in our homes.
label: nonconclusion

split_speech_text: As the federal representative for Vancouver South, I will continue to advocate initiatives that will make our streets and homes safer.
label: conclusion
